newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand details measures on financial institution.
newsitem.headline: Thailand details measures on financial institution.

text.p: The Bank of Thailand on Tuesday suspended 42 troubled finance firms in an attempt to inspire public and investor confidence in the country's ailing financial sector.
The move raised the number of finance firms whose operations were suspended to 58.

Bank of Thailand Governor Chaiyawat Wibulswasdi told reporters that the finance companies have borrowed about 430 billion baht ($13.9 billion) from the central bank's Financial Institutions Development Fund.
Officials estimated that the money the fund lent to the whole sector was about 500 billion baht.
"Loss of confidence in the financial sector caused the problems. The fund has almost come to the point that it can no longer support the troubled companies with liquidity," Chaiyawat said.
"This measure will separate the healthy financial firms from the troubled ones. It is expected to stop the negative rumours and the confidence in the sector will be restored," he said.
The following measures were taken by the central bank:
-- Clearly separate good from bad financial institutions by suspending 42 firms on the top of the 16 ailing finance firms suspended in late June
-- Limit the role of the Financial Institution Development Fund in propping up financial institutions

-- The new suspended firms were given 60 days to come up with rehabilitation plans and due diligence. The central bank will decide on a case by case basis whether they can resume business within one month after receiving the proposed plans.
-- The central bank said both creditors, domestic or foreign, and depositors of the troubled firms will be fully protected
-- Depositors of companies that have been ordered to suspend operations can exchange their promissory notes and negotiable certificates of deposits (NCDs) at state-run Krung Thai Bank Plc.
-- Creditors of the troubled companies will also have the right to exchange notes or NCDs or arrange for a new borrowing contract with Krung Thai Bank
-- The government will set up a deposit insurance institution. Meanwhile, the Financial Institution Development Fund will guarantee deposits in the remaining healthy firms.
